document_data.name: Temple of the God-Kings
document_data.mainbody: The '''temple of the God-Kings''' in [[Bezantur]] was the only temple to the [[Mulhorandi pantheon]] that was allowed to exist in [[Thay]] as of the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Location: This temple was located outside the walls of Bezantur,
document_data.Structure: The temple was a ziggurat, the traditional symbol of the Mulhorandi pantheon.
document_data.Activities: While the worship of the God-Kings of [[Mulhorand]] was repressed by the [[Red Wizards of Thay]], many commonfolk continued to honor them as the gods of their ancestors. Owing to the hostility toward the religion, the high [[priest]] of this temple was frequently jailed on accusations of sedition.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1357}}, the high priest was jailed for more than three months, leaving a junior priest to tend to the temple.
